Questions.Question: According to the lesson, Sam went from 0% test coverage to what percentage after applying hexagonal testing strategies?
Questions.Explanation: Sam's story shows going from 0% to 85% test coverage in a week by applying the testing pyramid: pure domain tests, use case tests with mocks, and integration tests for adapters.

Questions.Question: According to the lesson, domain layer tests require mock objects because the domain depends on database interfaces.
Questions.Explanation: Domain tests are PURE unit tests that need NO mocks! The domain layer has no external dependencies, so you can test entities and value objects directly without any mocking.

Questions.Question: According to the testing pyramid, which layers require integration tests with REAL dependencies? Select ALL that apply.
Options: Driving adapters (HTTP handlers with full stack)
Questions.Explanation: Adapters require integration tests with real dependencies. Database repositories need real databases (or testcontainers). E2E tests through driving adapters test the full stack. Domain and use cases use unit tests.

Questions.Question: According to the lesson, use cases should be tested with _______ adapters that implement the port interfaces.
Questions.Explanation: Use cases are tested with mock/fake adapters injected through the constructor. For example, InMemoryBookRepository implements BookRepository for fast, isolated testing.
